page.title: 10TRADITIONS UPHELD
page.content: Years ago,before maps and books were easily available,it was the custom once a year to {Beat the Bounds} of the parish. It was the best way of drumming into people's minds just where the boundaries of the parish lay. It was of important to know because it used to be the parish that helped you out in time of need.Some say that the choir boys were beaten to make quite sure they remembered. Nowdays in sprawling suburbia it is just as important to feel that we belong somewhere. Parts of Mottingham are in the borough of Greenwich,Bromley and Lewisham.The only boundery that really makes sense is the old parish boundary of St.Andrew so the choir and parishioners countinue the custom.
